make_fringe_frame_imaging¶

gempy.science.gmosScience.make_fringe_frame_imaging(adInputs, fl_vardq='AUTO', method='median', outNames=None, suffix=None, log=None, logName='gemini.log', logLevel=1, noLogFile=False)[source]¶

This function will create and return a single fringe image from all the inputs. It utilizes the CL script gifringe to create the fringe image.

NOTE: The inputs to this function MUST be prepared.

A string representing the name of the log file to write all log messages to can be defined, or a default of ‘gemini.log’ will be used. If the file all ready exists in the directory you are working in, then this file will have the log messages during this function added to the end of it.

Parameters:
  • adInputs (Astrodata objects, either a single or a list of objects) – Astrodata inputs to be combined
  • fl_vardq (Python boolean (True/False), OR string ‘AUTO’ to do it automatically if there are VAR and DQ frames in the inputs. NOTE: ‘AUTO’ uses the first input to determine if VAR and DQ frames exist, so, if the first does, then the rest MUST also have them as well.) – Create variance and data quality frames?
  • method (string, options: ‘average’, ‘median’.) – type of combining method to use.
  • outNames (String, either a single or a list of strings of same length as adInputs.) – filenames of output(s)
  • suffix (string) – string to add on the end of the input filenames (or outNames if not None) for the output filenames.
  • log (A gemLog object from astrodata/adutils/gemLog.py . It is an upgraded version of the Python logger for use with all new scripts in gemini_python/ . Note: the logName, logLevel and noLogFile will be automatically determined from the logger object passed in to ‘log’ with the ScienceFunctionManager.startUp() function.) – logger object to send log messges to
  • logName (String, None causes default to be used.) – Name of the log file, default is ‘gemini.log’
  • logLevel (integer from 0-6, 0=nothing to screen, 6=everything to screen. OR the message level as a string (ie. ‘critical’, ‘status’, ‘fullinfo’...)) – verbosity setting for the log messages to screen, default is ‘critical’ messages only. Note: independent of logLevel setting, all messages always go to the logfile if it is not turned off.
  • noLogFile (Python boolean (True/False)) – A boolean to make it so no log file is created
